Script.name: Rent Database Creation
Script.script:
db:create( "rents", { storage = { name = "", room = 0, zone = "", item = "", cost = "", timestamp = db:Timestamp("CURRENT_TIMESTAMP"), }, } )
rents = rents or {}
rents.help = [[ <cyan>Rent Script<reset>
This script will track items that you have stored in your rents in a database located at ]] .. getMudletHomeDir() .. [[/Database_rents.db
Below is a brief overview of some commands that this script includes. All commands can be found in the appropriate rents folder under mudlet aliases.
<cyan>Commands:<reset> <yellow>rents display<reset> - Display all items in the rent database <yellow>rents display name character<reset> - Displays all items in the rent database associated with a particular character name. Not case sensitive. Examples: rents display name Adael, rents display name bludlust <yellow>rents display item keyword(s)<reset> - Display all items in the rent database that contain the given keyword(s). Not case sensitive, but if multiple keywords are used the order (and, if applicable, punctuation) matters. Examples: rents display item heron-engraved, rents display item a crystal lightstick <yellow>rents display zone keyword(s)<reset> - Display all items in the rent database whose zone name (in my map data) contains the provided keyword(s). Not case sensitive, but if multiple keywords are used the order (and, if applicable, punctuation) matters. Examples: rents display zone Caemlyn, rents display zone bandar eban, rents display zone thakan'dar
]]

Script.name: Rents Display Echo
Script.script:
function rents:echo(what, err) local rents_tag = "<lawn_green>(<green>rents<lawn_green>): <white>" local err_tag = "<coral>(<red>error<coral>): <white>"
if what:sub(0,1)=="\n" then cecho("\n") what = what:sub(2) end cecho(rents_tag) if err then cecho(err_tag) end cecho(what) end
